author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Indian Coast Guard on Wednesday detained nine Sri Lankan fishermen and seized two mechanised boats on charge of straying into Indian waters.

The personnel of Coast Guard ship Sagar secured the fishermen east off Nagapattinam when they were fishing in the Indian waters.

Preliminary enquiry revealed that they were from Trincomalee. All of them were deep sea fishermen.

While one of the boats with four fishermen had ventured into the sea on February 12, another boat with five fishermen began its journey on February 15 from Trincomalee, sources said.
title: Nine Sri Lankan fishermen held
